page.title: 01Lower Hergest area
page.content: The area is dominated by Hergest Ridge an elongated hill topped by an uncultivated moorland, covered with bracken and gorse, with long green rides and supporting a few sheep. Offas dyke path follows the length of the ridge but the dyke itself seems now to be only ocasionaly discernable/ The lower slopes of the hill are mainly enclosed fields of rough grazing, supporting sheep, apart from the Northern slopes of the hill, and Worsell Wood Hill, which have been planted with conifers . There are isolated farms. Lower Hergest is th only centre of population in the area, and consists of about 10 small dwellings, irregularly sited along a narrow land, and whose only facilities appear to be a post box and an isoated telephone box sited well outside hamlet
